    • purchaseAsset

      public boolean purchaseAsset(String assetSymbol, double amount)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Record a purchase of the named asset if available funds >= the total value of the assets (stock or cryptocurrency) being purchased. The price paid should be the real live price of the asset.
      Specified by:
      purchaseAsset in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetSymbol - the name of the asset (stock symbol or cryptocurrency) to purchase
      amount - the amount of the asset to purchase
      Returns:
      True if the asset is purchased successfully, otherwise False.

    • sellAsset

      public boolean sellAsset(String assetSymbol, double amount)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Record a sale of the named asset (stock or cryptocurrency) at the current live market value if we hold that asset. The sale price should be the real live price of the asset at the time of sale retrieved from an appropriate web API. The revenue generated from the sale should be added to the total funds available to the user.

      Business logic: If we hold > 1 units of the specified asset (say 10 units of Microsoft stock MSFT), and the parameter amount is < total units of the stock, we should sell the units that maximise our profit. Remember some of the stock could have been purchased on different dates and therefore have been purchased at different price points.

      Specified by:
      sellAsset in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetSymbol - the name of the asset (stock symbol or cryptocurrency) to sell
      amount - the amount of the asset to sell
      Returns:
      True if the asset is sold successfully, otherwise false (we may not have that asset in our portfolio)

    • getTrendingStocks

      public List<String> getTrendingStocks(String region)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Returns a list of trending stocks symbols, their current market price and the days gain or loss in price and as a percentage. Yahoo finance provides this information for you.
      Specified by:
      getTrendingStocks in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      region - a string country code specifying the region of interest. Examples include US, GB, FR, DE, HK
      Returns:
      a list of strings each representing trending stock symbols e.g. APPL, TSLA, BARC

    • getHistoricalData

      public List<AssetQuote> getHistoricalData(List<String> assetSymbols, String interval, String range)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve a set of historic data points for the specified assets.
      Specified by:
      getHistoricalData in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetSymbols - a list of strings representing the symbols of the assets for which we need to obtain Historic data.
      interval - a String representing the time interval between quotes. Valid values include 1m 5m 15m 1d 1wk 1mo
      range - a String representing the time range over which we should obtain historic data for the specified assets. Valid values include 1d 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 5y, max. Where max represents the maximum available duration (lifetime of the asset).
      Returns:
      A list of assetQuotes objects.

    • getExchangeSummary

      public String getExchangeSummary(String region, String exchange)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Returns summary information on an exchange in the region specified.
      Specified by:
      getExchangeSummary in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      region - a string country code specifying the region of interest. Examples include US, GB, FR, DE, HK
      exchange - a string specifying the exchange we want information on. Examples include FTSE, DOW, DASDAQ, DAX
      Returns:
      a String containing exchange summary information. Data includes at a minimum the exchange name, exchange symbol, previous closing value, opening value, gain/loss since opening. Add any additional data you feel is relevant.

    • getAssetInformation

      public List<AssetQuote> getAssetInformation(List<String> assetNames)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve realtime quote data for the assets within the list assetNames from the online exchange.
      Specified by:
      getAssetInformation in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetNames - a list of asset symbols for example, "Bitcoin-USD", "Appl", "TSLA"
      Returns:
      A list of AssetQuote objects. Return an empty list if we have no assets in our portfolio.

      getPortfolioValue in interface PortfolioSystem

    • listAllInvestments

      public String listAllInvestments()
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Returns a formatted string detailing the name, symbol, average purchase price, current value and amount of each asset within the portfolio. The difference in average purchase price and current price should also be displayed in both USD and as a percentage.
      Specified by:
      listAllInvestments in interface PortfolioSystem
      Returns:
      a String containing summary information on the assets in the portfolio.

    • listPortfolioAssetsByType

      public String listPortfolioAssetsByType(String assetType)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve a formatted string containing all of the assets within the portfolio of the specified asset type ("stock" or "cryptocurrencies"). String contains the name, symbol, average purchase price, current value and amount of each asset within the portfolio. The difference in average purchase price and current price are displayed in USD and as a percentage.
      Specified by:
      listPortfolioAssetsByType in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetType - a string specifying the asset type. Valid values are "stock" or "crypto"
      Returns:
      a formatted String containing summary of all of the investments within the portfolio. Return an empty string if we have no assets within our portfolio.

    • listPortfolioAssetsByName

      public String listPortfolioAssetsByName(List<String> assetNames)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve a formatted String containing details on all of the assets within the portfolio matching the assetName in full or partially. String contains the name, symbol, average purchase price, current value and amount of each asset within the portfolio. The difference in average purchase price and current price are displayed in USD and as a percentage.
      Specified by:
      listPortfolioAssetsByName in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      assetNames - a list of Strings containing asset symbols such as "MSFT" or "BTC-USD" or full name "Bitcoin USD" or partial string "Bitco"
      Returns:
      A formatted String containing summary information for the assetNames provided in the list. Return an empty string if we have no matching assets.

    • listPortfolioPurchasesInRange

      public String listPortfolioPurchasesInRange(long startTimeStamp, long endTimeStamp)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve a formatted String containing summary information for all assets within the portfolio purchased between the dates startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp. Summary information contains the purchase price, current price, difference between the purchase and sale price (in USD and as a percentage).

      If the several units of the asset have been purchased at different time points between the startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp, list each asset purchase separately by date (oldest to most recent).

      Specified by:
      listPortfolioPurchasesInRange in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      startTimeStamp - a UNIX timestamp representing the start range date
      endTimeStamp - a UNIX timestamp representing the end range date
      Returns:
      A formatted String containing summary information for all of the assets purchased between the startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp. Return an empty string if we have no matching assets in our portfolio.

    • listPortfolioSalesInRange

      public String listPortfolioSalesInRange(long startTimeStamp, long endTimeStamp)
      Description copied from interface: PortfolioSystem
      Retrieve a formatted string containing a summary of all of the assets sales between the dates startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp. Summary information contains the average purchase price for each asset, the sale price and the profit or loss (in USD and as a percentage).

      If the several units of the asset have been sold at different time points between the startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp, list by date (oldest to most recent) each of those individual sales.

      Specified by:
      listPortfolioSalesInRange in interface PortfolioSystem
      Parameters:
      startTimeStamp - a UNIX timestamp representing the start range date
      endTimeStamp - a UNIX timestamp representing the end range date
      Returns:
      A formatted String containing summary information for all of the assets sold between the startTimeStamp and endTimeStamp. Return an empty string if we have no matching assets in our portfolio.
